slide.title: Compiling
slide.blurb: The *config.m4* file adds any extension-specific configuration options. If your extension relies on external libraries and header files, you need to define those in this file and uncomment the *--with-tidy* section. If your extension does not rely on any external libraries, uncomment the *--enable-tidy* section.

The *ext_skel* script created a sample *tidy.php* script. A quick way to check if your extension is working is to edit this script and add *dl('tidy.so')* to the top. Then run it through your command-line PHP parser:
slide.example: % php -q tidy.php Congratulations! You have successfully modified ext/tidy/config.m4. Module tidy is now compiled into PHP.
